p: The virus responsible for the epidemic that began in Wuhan was simultaneously identified by Wu et al. ( 9), and by Zhou et al. ( 10), who named it WH-Human 1 and 2019-nCoV, respectively. These researchers also deciphered the virus genome, its origin from bat coronaviruses, and ACE2 as its receptor on the membrane of host cells. On February 11, 2020, the WHO officially named the infection COVID-19 and the virus as SARS-CoV-2 ( 24).
